alert.note: Alert for Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 6:14PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Band of heavier rain will move through Napa County through the remainder of the evening. Locally heavier rain amounts possible over the Mayacama Mountains. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Napa and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 915 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 612 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.3 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.7 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Napa, American Canyon, St. Helena, Calistoga, Yountville, Deer Park and Angwin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
